quotes: As an Indian, seeing the Taj Mahal fills me with immense pride in our heritage.
The craftsmanship is breathtaking - you can feel the love that went into every detail.
It's beautiful but also sad to think about the workers who built it.
Standing here, you can almost hear the roar of the crowds from 2000 years ago.
It's magnificent but haunting - so many died here for entertainment.
A testament to what humans can build, for better or worse.
As a Chinese person, the Great Wall represents our ancestors' determination and sacrifice.
It's incredible, but we must remember the millions who died building it.
Walking on it, you feel connected to thousands of years of history.
